body: I love this! I discovered it as an added ingredient with melatonin. Normally melatonin alone gives me too many rapid fire dreams, so I don't feel as rested. But combined with this it helps me to relax and sleep more deeply. It's also safe to combine with 5-HTP, a supplement that can help alleviate depression. This combination really helped me get through a rough time after enduring loss. Grief is temporary and I didn't want to start a SSRI antidepressant, because it takes time to work and there are side effects, plus you need to taper off of standard antidepressants. I never experienced any side effects with this combination. I can take them when I need to and stop when I feel like it. We need more research into supplements like these for depression, anxiety, and insomnia. They work wonders and aren't addictive.
title: A versatile tool for wellbeing

body: I've been using this product for about 3 months.  I am on no other medications, so I feel l can talk about the benefits to myself and not attribute them to something else.  I don't have extreme anxiety like I have heard of people having, but I was experiencing low levels of anxiety all day long.  Anything little thing would cause me to cry. (I was crying a lot.) I read some other reviews and thought I would try this.  I feel much more calm and the crying has decreased by at least 75%.  Maybe more.  People kept telling me I was depressed, but I wasn't sad.  I realized I just had a lot of anxiety and this has helped me tremendously.
title: I don't have extreme anxiety like I have heard of people having

body: I was recommended these by my psychiatrist as a healthy alternative to prescription medication for my anxiety disorder. Boy does it help. She uses them for public speaking herself. There isn't a noticeable looped-out feeling, but rather, the L-Theanine helps maintain a feeling of well-ease during it's duration of effect. I'm a former Doctor of Pharmacy Candidate myself, and would recommend this to anyone trying to find a way to curb prescription anxiety medication. I still use the medicine, but this is much more preferable for when I know a situation is relatively under control and I'll just be prone to the familiar fear-loops.
title: At Ease Captain

body: I can't get over how much better I feel since I've started taking this.  And I noticed it on day 1!! body: Although I am a big believer in homeopathic remedies, I always try new supplements with a healthy dose of skepticism. It also seems to reduce anxiety/produces a sense of calm without making me feel drowsy. The fact that there is a supplement out there that can safely and effectively do both is pretty remarkable to me. -CG. RN, BSN.

I have chronic insomnia, but wake very early no matter how much sleep I've had, so mornings can been rather miserable for me.  After taking this for only a week with my first cup of coffee (and before I eat) I am noticing that I'm more alert and much less foggy than I was before. body: L-theanine is the amino acid in green tea that supposedly promotes relaxation. I am especially prone to the negative effects of coffee and it was only after I discovered L-theanine that I started to really enjoy coffee. I take some L-theanine before I drink a cup or before I have a heaping amount of dark chocolate (I just can't help myself sometimes!). The combination improves my focus, and my athletic and academic performance. I also try to take a pill before anxiety-provoking events (such as public speaking). I've taken to using L-theanine as a sleep aid as well, to calm my mind and body before bed.

body: I suffer from somewhat fitful sleep.  Yet, all of the sleeping meds, prescribed or over the counter including antihistamines make me ultra groggy the next day.  This isn't a "take one and become a zombie" sleeping aide, but it does knock down the constant "thinking" that keeps many of us awake.  Very, very helpful for me.  My wife on the other hand, who suffers from the same agitated sleep doesn't find it to be helpful at all.  So, this is probably one of those "works for some and not for others" kind of thing that might be worth trying if your options like mine are limited.
title: Works for me...not for her.

body: I occasionally suffer from mild anxiety and my doctor prescribed medicine for it but after a month I quit taking it because I didn't like the way it made me feel and I really don't like taking manufactured medicine daily.  I did a lot of research and found L-Theanine and valerian were recommended for anxiety relief.  The valerian works for me at night in a tea because it makes you drowsy.  The L-Theanine works for daytime and doesn't make me tired.  I have tried several brands and like Jarrow vitamins.  They seem to be better quality and are more dependable.
title: Relief from anxiety

body: These actually work at reducing my anxiety and stress.  I bought a drink at a gas station that claimed to help with stress.  This was the main ingredient at helping with stress.  It worked! body: I've been dealing with depression for a few years now that was getting worse and lasting longer and not sleeping well didn't help. I had read that Theanine could help and after reading a lot of information on it and the reviews on Amazon I decided to order this brand. I've been taking it daily for over a month now and can say that this really helps. The black cloud has lifted and I'm sleeping better. In fact I'm not sleeping as long as I used to and feel more energized than I've been in a long time. My desire to get out of the house and do something has increased and I'm busy more through the day. It's not a "high" feeling, it's that I'm suddenly aware that I'm motivated to get things done. I have been using this along with food grade diatomateous earth so I really feel that one has helped the other. My daughter has been using just this product with improvement too. Her anxiety is so much better. We will be ordering this regularly!
title: This is a great product!

It has put quite a significant damper on my anxiety. It helps me sleep at night. As another reviewer mentioned, when I want a quick "kick", I just open the capsule and empty the contents under my tongue. This isn't a miracle cure but it does the trick for me. I take up anywhere from 400 to 600 mg a day.

body: I decided to try out L-Theanine since I have really bad anxiety. I also have chronic fatigue and sleep too much. I was prescribed valium and other prescriptions but I didn't like the way they made me feel. I decided to order this brand after seeing the great views on Amazon and I'm so happy I did. It came in super fast. After 30 min. of taking one I felt calm, yet happy, and energetic. By the end of the day I felt more talkative, confident, focused, and overall just better mentally and emotionally. My boyfriend took one who doesn't have bad anxiety and didn't notice a huge difference but felt slightly less stressed. For me the effects were similar to a cup of coffee, which I never drink because it doesn't react with my nerves well but the L-theanine didn't make me feel jittery. I actually had too much energy and I had trouble staying asleep. I've decided to break them in half and take 100mg a day for a little while first. Bottom line, I feel great already and I feel the L-theanine is going to make a huge difference in my mood, my personal life, and my demanding job. I also bought rhodiola and now I'm thinking I may not need it. I guess we'll see.

body: I use this and Source Naturals GABA and 3 mgs of Melatonin for Sleep.  I take a small container.  Like the bottle Sleep Water comes in.  Pour 1/2 bottle with Grapefruit juice fill to the top with Grapefruit Juice and shake.  Let sit for 8 hours in refridge and reshake before ingesting it. Follow with 1/2 glass of Grapefruit Juice. The reason I stress Grapefruit Juice is it help's bypass enzymes produced by the Liver which will break it down minimizing the effect. I usually make two bottles incase I wake up in middle of the night.  Second bottle no Melatonin.  I've been on Valuim 5mg's 6x a day  and have a very high tolerance and Ambien 10 mg's for year. Probably since 1995. I've probably spent over $1,000 or more on sleep supplement's and none work.  I will not let my Doctor know about the tolerance issue as she would put me on a SSRI which as a Clinical Psycologist know do more harm for sleep then good.  If you suffer from Insomnia I would try this as Sleep water ect does not work.  Most reviews of supplements that people claim help is the placebo effect.  Read the warning's on each product and follow as per instructions.  All I can say is this works for me.

body: I am using this for my hyper-reactive rescue dog.  I have read that this helps reduce reactivity and enhances calmness.  I never tried this before and I've been using it for my Pomeranian now for about 2 months.  He gets half a tablet in his breakfast.  From what I understand, this product does not create a calm dog overnight and that's ok with me as long as I see some results.  I have to say, I think it is starting to work.  I took him to the park yesterday where there was a lacrosse team practice...he walked right by, no barking...there were 3 little kids in the playground area running & screaming (which is a serious trigger for him) and he walked by, stopped and watched for a moment, then walked away without reacting!  That was huge for him.  Lastly, we met up with a lovely, large Wheaton Terrier in the park and he was a total little Mr. Manners!  So far, I'm quite pleased with the results and will continue using this.
title: I'm quite pleased with the results and will continue using this
